meanings.definition: Less ample or abundant than is usual or desirable
meanings.sent1: The dress she wore to the party was skimpier than her usual style.
meanings.sent2: The skimpier portions of the meal were not satisfying for the hungry guests.
meanings.sent3: He tried to fit all his clothes in the skimpier suitcase, but it just wouldn't close.
meanings.sent4: The skimpier budget for the project meant they had to cut corners to make it work.
meanings.sent5: The skimpier details in the painting left much to the viewer's imagination.

meanings.sent1: The skimpier shirt was too tight for him to wear comfortably.
meanings.sent2: Her skimpier hairdo made her look younger than her actual age.
meanings.sent3: The skimpier balloon couldn't float as high as the others at the fair.
meanings.sent4: His skimpier knowledge of the subject made it challenging for him to pass the test.
meanings.sent5: The skimpier clouds in the sky hinted at a sunny day ahead.
